Review_Body: The trip started lovely we went to Murano island first and later we head to this lovely island Burano. We have been told where to meet and what time we leaving to the third island. Unfortunately, me and my mum were lost on the island and waited on the wrong side of the port. The boat left without us. It is our fault that we waited in the wrong spot but the trip organiser at least should off left w con tact number in emergency. We have been left on the island, and had to organise a transport to come back. We have missed the last part of the trip. The islands we managed to see were lovely but not happy about how the trip were organised.

Abbiamo prenotato il tour con l’aspettativa che la guida fosse un po’ più presente durante il corso della giornata. In realtà ha solamente spiegato alcune nozioni basilari sulle isole che vedevamo durante gli spostamenti a Murano, Burano e Torcello (sul ritorno non ci sono state spiegazioni). Sulle isole era interamente in autogestione. Interessante la spiegazione e la dimostrazione sull’isola di Murano. Considerata l’esperienza, consiglio di utilizzare i vaporetti di linea per raggiungere le isole in autonomia e organizzarsi per partecipare a una dimostrazione a Murano (specie perché il giornaliero o l’abbonamento per più giorni dei vaporetti viene spesso già acquistato per raggiungere il centro o girare più facilmente la città). In questo modo, ci sarebbe più libertà nel decidere gli orari degli spostamenti (su alcune isole saremmo rimasti più a lungo di quanto concesso). Se si ipotizza di fare acquisti sull’isola di Murano, consigliamo inoltre di visitarla per ultima così da evitare di dover trascorrere l’intera giornata con i sacchetti degli acquisti. Infine pensiamo che la visita a Torcello sia da fare se si ha il tempo (e la voglia) di visitare l’interno degli edifici sull’isola (chiesa… nota: ingresso a pagamento). Per quanto gli edifici all’esterno siano comunque belli, considerato il percorso a piedi da fare per arrivarci potrebbe non valerne la pena.

Found this boat trip through an email from booking.com and it didn't disappoint. The three Islands all had slightly different draws and there was some interesting information from the tour guide, although it was quite limited considering how many languages they needed to say each item in. The glass demonstration at Murano was brilliant, although I'd suggest sitting near the front if you can to get a good view. Our boat was split into two groups (one upstairs and one downstairs) so there was enough room per demonstration which helped. There was some amazing pieces in the shop, however I would suggest walking 2 minutes out of the museum towards the coast where there are several more shops with reasonable pricing. Burano was beautiful and the coloured houses were great for photos, although due to the amount of tours arriving at the same time it was difficult to find somewhere to eat and I would suggest going for food first, then wander, or bring some with you. Torcello was also interesting with some great buildings, but the Church's were a good walk from the boat which could be a struggle for some people within the time they give you. Overall well worth the €25 fee, considering that paying for an all day boat ticket alone would cost you that much. Would recommend.

The glass demonstration at Murano is amazing. After the glass demonstration you can either visit the island or stay at the souvenir shop for about 1:15 h. As a tip: if you really want to know the island, don't get to distracted on the shop. The tour is worth it, if you do not want to worry about transportation. Although if your intention is to stay on one of these islands for more than an hour or so, I recommend to find a different way of transportation. In our case we were very satisfied with the transportation and little pieces of interesting facts they gave while we were on the boat. While on the islands you are on your own. Be always aware to return to the boat on time , otherwise you will be left behind with no right to a refund. Form the three islands Burano is by far the most amazing. In our case we decided to stay on this stop and then find our own way back to Venice, because we went to a restaurant and it took a while for the food to be ready. Then we walked the place and bought some souvenirs. Another tip: if you don't want to be left behind at Burano, don't eat at a restaurant here. It is better to wait until the bout goes back to Venice. Overall we had a very good experience with this tour.
